## Languages in Finland, 1990-2024
### List of minority language spoken in Finland, years 1990-2024


``` {r Quantiles}
tulos <- readRDS("C://R//tulos.rds")
#define quantiles of interest
# q = c(.25, .5, .75)
q = c(.75, .95)

#calculate quantiles 75 and 95 by year
qt<-tulos %>%
  group_by(Year) %>%
 summarize(quant75 = quantile(`Population 31 Dec`, probs = q[1]), 
            quant95 = quantile(`Population 31 Dec`, probs = q[2]))

tulos<-dplyr::left_join(tulos, qt,by = 'Year')

tulos_frak <- tulos  %>%
  dplyr::mutate (koko = case_when(`Population 31 Dec` < quant95 ~ 0,
                                  `Population 31 Dec` >= quant95 ~ 1))
tulos_highlighted <- tulos %>%
  mutate(
    highlight = ifelse(Rank <= 15, TRUE, FALSE)
  )


# tulos_frak<-tulos_frak %>% 
#   dplyr::select(Rank, everything())
```

**Background:**  
Top 15 languages (by population) → **black background** with **yellow text**.  
Other languages → **white background** with **black text**.

```{r graph path data preparation, echo=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
# knitr::knit2html('languages.Rmd', stylesheet = 'flat-table.css')
# start <- 1990
start <- 2014
end <- 2024
rank <- 15

language_start <- tulos %>% 
  ungroup () %>% 
  filter (Year ==start & Rank <= rank) %>% 
  select(2)

language_start_list <- language_start$Language

language_end <- tulos %>% 
  filter (Year == end & Rank <= rank) %>% 
  ungroup () %>% 
  select(2)

languages_most <- unique(dplyr::bind_rows(language_start,language_end))
data_most <- tulos %>% 
             select (Year, Language, `Population 31 Dec`, Rank) %>% 
             filter(Language %in% pull(languages_most) & Year %in% c(start,end)) %>% 
             arrange (Year) %>% 
             mutate(Language =fct_reorder((stringr::str_remove(Language,"(\\,|\\;)\\s+\\w+")),
                                          `Population 31 Dec`,
                                          max),
                    pop_label = 1000*round(`Population 31 Dec`/1000,1)
                    # lab_lang = ifelse(Year == end,  Language, NA), 
             ) %>% arrange (Year, desc(Rank))
# data_most <- data_most %>% 
#              filter(`Population 31 Dec` >= 1000 )  
number_lang <-length(languages_most %>% pull)
table <- 
  data_most %>% 
  select(-pop_label) %>% 
  rename(Population = `Population 31 Dec`) %>% 
  tidyr::pivot_wider(
     names_from = c(Year),
     values_from = c(Rank,Population)
  ) %>% 
  # mutate(Change_rank = Rank_1990 -Rank_2021, Change_pop = Population_2021 - Population_1990) %>% 
    mutate(`Change in rank` = .[[2]] -.[[3]], `Change in pop` = .[[5]] - .[[4]]) %>% 
  arrange(.[[3]])

ukr <- which(table$Language ==  "Ukrainian") #-- select row by Ukrainian, because it'd impossible later

table$`Change in rank` = cell_spec(table$`Change in rank`, color = ifelse(table$`Change in rank` >= 0, "blue", "red")) 
# table$Language = cell_spec(table$Language, color = ifelse(table$Language == "Ukrainian", "orange", "green"))


kbl(
  table, escape = F,
  "html",
  col.names = gsub("[_]", " ", names(table)),
  caption = paste(
    "The most spoken languages in years",
    start,
    "and",
    end,
    "by rank in",
    end
  ),
  format.args = list(big.mark = " ")
) %>%
  kable_classic_2 ("striped", full_width = T) %>% 
   row_spec(0, bold = T, color = "white",italic = TRUE, background = "#D7261E")  %>% 
   column_spec (1, bold = T, color = "white", background = "#D7261E") %>% 
   row_spec(ukr, bold = T, italic = TRUE, angle = -10, color = "#210236", background = "#c6f7e5") %>% 
   kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover"))

   # %>%  
   #   kable_classic() kable_material_dark()
```

```{r graph path, echo=FALSE,warning=FALSE, fig.dim = c(15, 15) }

# Add a column for growth status
arrow_data <- data_most %>%
  group_by(Language) %>%
  summarize(
    start_year = min(Year),
    end_year = max(Year),
    start_pop = `Population 31 Dec`[Year == min(Year)],
    end_pop = `Population 31 Dec`[Year == max(Year)]
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    pop_diff = end_pop - start_pop,
    label = paste0("Δ", pop_diff),  # Difference label
    growth_status = ifelse(end_pop > start_pop, "Growing", "Decreasing"),  # Growth status
    start_pop_zero = 0,  # All arrows start at zero
    end_pop_adjusted = end_pop - start_pop  # Adjust end_pop relative to start_pop
  )

# Extract start and end years dynamically from the data
start_year <- min(arrow_data$start_year)
end_year <- max(arrow_data$end_year)

# Create the plot
ggplot(arrow_data) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      x = start_pop_zero, xend = end_pop_adjusted,
      y = reorder(Language, pop_diff), yend = reorder(Language, pop_diff),
      color = growth_status  # Set color based on growth status
    ),
    arrow = arrow(length = unit(3, "mm"), type = "closed"),
    size = 1
  ) +
  geom_text(
    aes(
      x = (start_pop_zero + end_pop_adjusted) / 2,
      y = reorder(Language, pop_diff),
      label = label
    ),
    vjust = -0.5,
    size = 5,
    family = "Bookman",
    color = "blue"
  ) +
  geom_text(
    aes(
      x = start_pop_zero,
      y = reorder(Language, pop_diff),
      label = start_pop
    ),
    vjust = 1.5,
    size = 3.5,
    family = "Bookman",
    color = "springgreen4"
  ) +
  geom_text(
    aes(
      x = end_pop_adjusted,
      y = reorder(Language, pop_diff),
      label = end_pop
    ),
    vjust = -1.7,  # Position above the line
    hjust = 0,
    size = 3.5,
    family = "Bookman",
    color = "orangered3"
  ) +
  labs(
    title = paste("Population Changes Between", start_year, "and", end_year),
    x = "Population",
    y = "Language",
    color = "Growth Status"  # Legend title
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c("Growing" = "seagreen", "Decreasing" = "tomato3")  # Customize colors
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_blank(),  # Remove x-axis number labels
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 14, color = "darkgreen"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 16, color = "purple"),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 16, color = "brown"),
    legend.title = element_text(size = 14),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 12)
  )
```
